tha-ap122:0.2_0: The Longer Discourse on the Māluṅkya
tha-ap122:0.3_0: Held together, frightened, and terrified, with senior monks.
tha-ap122:1.1_0: He is born from his mother,
tha-ap122:10.1_0: That is how these verses were recited by the senior venerable Pūraṇa Kassapa.
tha-ap122:11.1_0: Old age and death, the senior monks who had gone beyond rebirth.
tha-ap122:12.1_0: The twelfth section in the Great Wood is finished.
tha-ap122:14.5_0: the verses spoken of the Buddha,
tha-ap122:2.2_0: the Buddhas in the world will become a Buddha,
tha-ap122:2.3_0: and the best of all creatures,
tha-ap122:3.3_0: have no honor anyone like this,
tha-ap122:4.3_0: Having made birth in old age,
tha-ap122:5.3_0: I am known as sentient beings,
tha-ap122:7.2_0: the best I was worshipped in those worthy.
tha-ap122:7.3_0: I’m not aware of any bad places
tha-ap122:9.1_0: Attaining the four kinds of textual analysis
